      393
      113 S B St
      San Mateo, CA 94401
      (650) 931-1770

      It's Philz so you know it's got good, candy-like coffee. Decor, service, product are all on point. There's no place like Philz and it stands above your typical chain or neighborhood cafe. The one negative is that this place gets packed and busy. That means long lines at times and a challenge to find a seat. At times it also feels like a hangout for young adults. That's the price to be paid for being good and hip. The other negative is traffic/parking in downtown San Mateo.

      This is my go-to spot in downtown San Mateo. When I have my "work from home" days, this is where I go! The baristas are always super friendly, and are pretty consistent with making the drinks the same quality every time. Go-to drinks: - Mocha Tesora (hot or iced, depending on my mood), sweet and creamy, with a dash of cinnamon. Honestly, the cinnamon makes this already-awesome favorite even more decadent. If you're ordering it hot, ask them to put the cinnamon in the filter. If you want it less fatty/sweet, try subbing the cream with almond milk, and don't use sugar at all. It's actually pretty good and naturally sweet this way already. - Mint Mojito, sweet and creamy - Hot Chocolate (actually tastes really good iced, too), sweet and creamy, with a dash of cinnamon. Honestly the best hot chocolate I've had in any coffee shop. Been obssessed lately with their creamy jam toast, which is their sourdough bread with a generous spread of cream cheese and seasonal jam on top. To be honest though, I've only really liked this when they use the strawberry jam. I've had it with the apricot one and also the raspberry one, but they were not as good and well-balanced as the strawberry one. This is the biggest Philz I've been to, and it's super nice inside, plenty of chairs and outlets so you can plug in your laptops and chargers.

      My favorite part about this Philz is how genuinely awesome all the baristas are. Michele not only remembers you order but also always makes recommendations that you would actually want. She takes the time to get to know you as a person as well, something that you rarely get in a coffee shop anymore. Your birthday, your kids, your weekend plans? Things that even your friends often forget about she somehow always remembers, making for an all around great experience.

      Love this place! As a new San Mateo resident, a go to coffee place is a must for me. I've loved Phil for years and now that I know that there's one nearby to me, I can rest assured that I'll get a quality cup of joe for a great price and great atmosphere. My fave blends are the Tantalizing Turkish and Philharmonic. So yum! For those of you that don't know how it works here... you're on your own ;)

      August 21, 2016 Sunday - 7:45 AM for coffee 2 adults Atmosphere - 5 stars Food - 5 stars Service - 5 stars Background - We needed some coffee before breakfast. My friend loves this places and heading to this as it was on the way to breakfast. Atmosphere - This aint a Starbucks, each barista has their own work station with four pour overs. Food Drink - Large Silken Splendid straight up no cream no sugar. It was silky, I loved it. Service - Yeah it was my first time. There was no line and I walked straight up to the first barista I saw. My buddy taps me on the shoulder and tells me to get back in line. Flashes to Seinfield and the soup Nazi episode streamed in my head as I quickly moved back. She still smiled at us as she called us up to place our order. Future - Yes please or any other Philz location.

      Didn't even know there was a Philz in San Mateo. SCORE!! Philz is my go to on the Peninsula. Each pour over crafted with care and each one always comes out perfect. Truly a work of art and the only way I will start my day when traveling in the Bay Area. My go to is a toss between the Ambrosia Coffee of God or Anesthesia to the Upside. (Medium sweet & medium cream) Both are a medium blend and you can score a pound to take home for $18.00. (You may think that is expensive, but you get a whole pound and not 12 oz.) The staff is ALWAYS friendly and ask you to try your crafted cup before leaving to ensure you are 100% satisfied. Such a simple idea executed brilliantly. Thanks Philz. You make mornings bearable.

      Welcome to the neighborhood, Philz! You know, it's funny, I generally have a high disdain for chains (I still don't think Peet's has any business being in the heart of downtown San Mateo, just sayin'), but Philz is such a fantastic Bay Area success story that I'm thrilled we have these guys in the area now. Service is fast and friendly, the drink menu is simple but full of outstanding, sourced options, and the location is a comfortable, relaxed environment perfect for a business meeting, a casual afternoon, etc. I doubt you haven't heard of Philz, but if not, check it out!

      My favorite addition to Downtown San Mateo is definitely Philz Cofee. It serves as a great hangout spot and draws a great crowd to Downtown SM during the morning hours. If you're not down to wait and want to make Philz a daily habit I highly recommend downloading the OrderAhead App and ordering ahead using the app so when you stop by in the morning before work you can pick up your coffee and leave in 5 minutes flat. Otherwise if you decide to take a leisurely trip to Philz expect a wait! Everyone who has been to Philz has heard about the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. I highly recommend it for first time visitors who don't know what to order. Another popular drink here would be the Mocha Tesora, really rich in flavor. However my favorites are the Gingersnap Iced Coffee and a PhilHarmonic Medium/Medium. Their almond milk is out of this world! As for snacks I think the snacks rival the coffee in quality and flavor. I love getting the vegetable quiche which is perfect in texture and flavor. They recently added toasts, who doesn't love avocado toast? Definitely hoping they'll keep it on the menu as it is the perfect food item to start your day. They also have nice twists on your average bagel you can get it toasted with hummus and tomatoes/cucumbers! Overall love Philz here in Downtown SM! :)

      There's tons of space and seating here plus art work for sale on the walls! This is the biggest Philz I've been to. Every & their mom, including us, were looking for a quick breakfast place open in downtown San Mateo this past Labor Day. Philz pretty much seemed to be the only place (and of course they're way better than Starbucks & Peet's). We placed our drink order than the pay line is seperate per usual Philz standards and you can also order food here as well. I like how they have the display by the front of the line rather than when you hit the register. Also a little further down is their hot foods menu. I had placed an order for a toasted croissant, a Philz bagel, and we also shared a large Iced Mint Mojito. After a couple minutes the girl who rung me up called me and told me that the only plain bagel left looked kind of funny and she didn't want to serve it to me. We totally appreciated her honesty, as perhaps some other establishments would have just served it. So we went with the asiago bagel. After about 5-7 minutes the drink was ready, and our food was ready in about 7-10. But it was an extremely busy morning. The Philz bagel is AMAZING! It's cream cheese, cucumber, and tomato, and seasoned with olive oil and salt and pepper. Simple yet delicious, and even better with the asiago bagel. Philz has been consistent with their drink taste and quality at all of the locations I've been to. Staff members are friendly as well. The large space, consistency and friendly cashier warning me about a weird looking bagel deserves a 5 for sure.

      The best Philz location I've been! Interior is clean, bright, and spacious! This place is centrally located in downtown San Mateo with plenty of metered street parking, or a parking garage just a little ways away. I spent an amazing 4 hours getting work done here. Free wifi and plentiful outlets? Everyone had a laptop out and working! This location is one of the few that makes my mint mojito perfectly the first time around. You get in the line closest to the door to order, then move inner more to pay at the cashier! Service is friendly, though may be a bit slower compared to other locations. Clean bathroom here is a huge plus too!

      One of my favourite Philz to study at. Sometimes gets really hot (turn on the AC please!!). Everyone gets the Mojito, but I suggest trying some blends like the Haze (secret menu) and mixing it. My favourite is the Tesora Haze

      I love this Philz location. The baristas here are super friendly. Although this is one of the larger Philz location, the available seating is still limited because it is always crowded. However, if you luck out and find a comfy spot, it is great for studying, working, socializing, etc.

      I don't normally write reviews but with this location I had to. My boyfriend and I each ordered mint mojitos. As I was drinking, I would get small pieces of mint in my mouth. I decided to open the lid to remove the mint since it kept bothering me....when I opened the cup, there was at least a handful of mint leaves in there!! Loll I don't mind the mint but holy crap, it was like a whole plant was shoved in my cup. The Philz by SJSU only puts the two mint leafs on top of my drink so I was really surprised by the amount put in my large cup. Lol Anyway, I just wanted to share that. The drink came out good if u must know. Lol but next time I order a mint mojito at this location, I'll just ask for no mint leaves.

      We recently moved to San Mateo after having fallen in love with it. It's a story we like to tell people, it was raining and we ended up here at Philz. Except it's not true as I only just discovered. I somehow was able to check into the San Mateo location while in Redwood City, which lead to the honey and I believing that San Mateo was the place we wanted to live. It lead to us searching and finally finding a home in San Mateo. Which we love, so it all worked out. But apparently, we fell in love with Redwood City. And the Redwood City Philz was the Philz were visiting when we decided it would be an awesome area to live in. So after discovering this I switched over the review and am leaving a brand new (and correct) one for this location, which is amazing. We've been here numerous times and every time our service is steller. We've never had the polar bear issue at this location we had at Redwood City, and they've never mixed up our drink sizes. It's also awesome that this location is so close to Caltrain. Win! We adore this location and I was having the hardest time figuring out why it looked so different than the first time we were here! XD All in all, we'll keep coming back!

      WOW, I swear this place is always busy!! The seats and tables are always crammed with people either working, doing homework, catching up with friends, or just playing games and lingering. This place has a very hip and casual vibe, it's a big establishment, and the set-up is pretty interesting. I ordered a black Jacobs coffee (size small), and almost forgot to pay for it! (Phew, that was a close one) You are supposed to order your drink at the front counter, and then take it to the cashier at a separate counter to pay for it. The Jacobs is a very good dark roast beverage. It's super bitter and gives you energy that'll last forever! I have yet to try the famous Mint Mojito. Bathrooms here are so clean! Parking is ample; you've got parking garages on both sides of the street and lots of street parking available to pick from.

      Really enjoyed our iced, sweet, mocha tesora and Philz everything bagel. Considering that the bagel came with cream cheese, tomato, and cucumber, it was a great deal. Also, the staff are super friendly. I didn't know the ordering system: you order your coffee from the first line then move to the second to pay and order food/pastries. (Yes, I realized after the steps are on the wall.) Came on a Sunday and this place is busy all day long! Luckily we snagged a table but be prepared to not find a seat. The good thing is parking is free on Sundays, but again, the later in the day it is, the harder it is to find.

      Typical Philz coffee, which is pretty good. I generally prefer espresso drinks to pour over, but if you go sweet and creamy, it's hard to complain. Pretty big space with lots of power outlets. Even so, it's usually full.

      Hard to say if I'll make it back to this Philz Coffee again so here - bam !!! 5 stars. Big coffee shop. Nice atmosphere, love the vibe, love the staff, iced mint mojito coffee and with plenty enough mint. Considering the fact that I'm used to finding the huge Siren logo, I didn't have a hard time finding this location and parking wasn't difficult as well. There is a garage to the back of the coffee shop - JUST BRING CHANGE. It wasn't difficult to order my java from this shop and unlike other non-(SBUX) shops, I didn't feel intimidated by this one. The barista was really friendly/accommodating ! Most of all, the music that played was - of all tunes 90s music (Sublime, Nirvana, Gin Blossoms....) as if they knew I was coming that day. LOL ! Super cozy, very nice chill. Next time, San Mateo. Next time - it will be Philz, and it will be this shop !

      Coffee here is, as always, made only to order and with only the highest care and attention - much like any Philz. The friendly staff will gladly offer up suggestions if you feel like something different, and will happily customize if your drink isn't exactly how you wanted it to taste. Pro tip: Being able to order online (via OrderAhead) can save a lot of time if you already know what you want and just want to pop in to pick it up. The San Mateo branch is located in a gorgeous space with exposed brick all along one end, and two entrances, one for B street and one that leads out directly in the San Mateo downtown parking lot - convenient whether you've just parked or are just walking in. The unsurprising downside of the great location is that the space can become filled with people on laptops working away; there have been several times I've been by when there were just no empty seats available, so YMMV if you are planning to grab a seat or meet someone. Pros: Excellent coffee, expertly made Plenty of outlets for workers Good for working if you're not on a call Con: Plenty of workers for outlets Seating can fill up (see above)

      I have been to quite a few Philz and I have to admit, this is my favorite one. Its really deceiving from the outside but once you pass through those doors..the world seems to open up. Ok that was over dramatic but really it's so roomy inside! Its probably one of the larger Philz and I love the long bench in front of the barista where you can sit to wait for your perfectly brewed cup of joe. I'm not sure how they do it but its been perfect everytime I've been here. There are some locations that require multiple redo's but so far this one has been spot on. This Philz just seems easier to navigate especially if you are new to the way Philz operates. The smaller locations which are insanely packed adds to the newb confusion. Trust me, I have been there and didnt return for along time because of it. Here are my location preferences: San Mateo Sunnyvale Cupertino SF- Westborough SJ-Downtown and the palo alto locations are my least favorite of the bunch.

      Philz Coffee

        The one negative is that this place gets packed and busy. That means long lines at times and a challenge to find a seat. At times it also feels like a hangout for young adults. That's the price to be paid for being good and hip. The other negative is traffic/parking in downtown San Mateo.

        This is my go-to spot in downtown San Mateo. When I have my "work from home" days, this is where I go! The baristas are always super friendly, and are pretty consistent with making the drinks the same quality every time.

        Go-to drinks:
        - Mocha Tesora (hot or iced, depending on my mood), sweet and creamy, with a dash of cinnamon. Honestly, the cinnamon makes this already-awesome favorite even more decadent. If you're ordering it hot, ask them to put the cinnamon in the filter. If you want it less fatty/sweet, try subbing the cream with almond milk, and don't use sugar at all. It's actually pretty good and naturally sweet this way already.
        - Mint Mojito, sweet and creamy
        - Hot Chocolate (actually tastes really good iced, too), sweet and creamy, with a dash of cinnamon. Honestly the best hot chocolate I've had in any coffee shop.

        Been obssessed lately with their creamy jam toast, which is their sourdough bread with a generous spread of cream cheese and seasonal jam on top. To be honest though, I've only really liked this when they use the strawberry jam. I've had it with the apricot one and also the raspberry one, but they were not as good and well-balanced as the strawberry one.

        This is the biggest Philz I've been to, and it's super nice inside, plenty of chairs and outlets so you can plug in your laptops and chargers.

        August 21, 2016 Sunday - 7:45 AM for coffee
        2 adults

        Atmosphere - 5 stars
        Food - 5 stars
        Service - 5 stars

        Background - We needed some coffee before breakfast.  My friend loves this places and heading to this as it was on the way to breakfast.  

        Atmosphere - This aint a Starbucks, each barista has their own work station with four pour overs.

        Food
         Drink - Large Silken Splendid straight up no cream no sugar.  It was silky, I loved it.

        Service - Yeah it was my first time.  There was no line and I walked straight up to the first barista I saw.  My buddy taps me on the shoulder and tells me to get back in line.  Flashes to Seinfield and the soup Nazi episode streamed in my head as I quickly moved back.  She still smiled at us as she called us up to place our order.

        Future - Yes please or any other Philz location.

        8/29/2016

        Didn't even know there was a Philz in San Mateo.  SCORE!!

        Philz is my go to on the Peninsula.  Each pour over crafted with care and each one always comes out perfect.  Truly a work of art and the only way I will start my day when traveling in the Bay Area.

        My go to is a toss between the Ambrosia Coffee of God or Anesthesia to the Upside. (Medium sweet & medium cream)  Both are a medium blend and you can score a pound to take home for $18.00. (You may think that is expensive, but you get a whole pound and not 12 oz.)

        The staff is ALWAYS friendly and ask you to try your crafted cup before leaving to ensure you are 100% satisfied.  Such a simple idea executed brilliantly.  Thanks Philz.  You make mornings bearable.

        You know, it's funny, I generally have a high disdain for chains (I still don't think Peet's has any business being in the heart of downtown San Mateo, just sayin'), but Philz is such a fantastic Bay Area success story that I'm thrilled we have these guys in the area now.

        Service is fast and friendly, the drink menu is simple but full of outstanding, sourced options, and the location is a comfortable, relaxed environment perfect for a business meeting, a casual afternoon, etc.

        I doubt you haven't heard of Philz, but if not, check it out!

        My favorite addition to Downtown San Mateo is definitely Philz Cofee. It serves as a great hangout spot and draws a great crowd to Downtown SM during the morning hours. If you're not down to wait and want to make Philz a daily habit I highly recommend downloading the OrderAhead App and ordering ahead using the app so when you stop by in the morning before work you can pick up your coffee and leave in 5 minutes flat. Otherwise if you decide to take a leisurely trip to Philz expect a wait!

        Everyone who has been to Philz has heard about the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. I highly recommend it for first time visitors who don't know what to order. Another popular drink here would be the Mocha Tesora, really rich in flavor. However my favorites are the Gingersnap Iced Coffee and a PhilHarmonic Medium/Medium. Their almond milk is out of this world!

        As for snacks I think the snacks rival the coffee in quality and flavor. I love getting the vegetable quiche which is perfect in texture and flavor. They recently added toasts, who doesn't love avocado toast? Definitely hoping they'll keep it on the menu as it is the perfect food item to start your day. They also have nice twists on your average bagel you can get it toasted with hummus and tomatoes/cucumbers!

        Overall love Philz here in Downtown SM! :)

        • Listed in B is for Breakfast..

        There's tons of space and seating here plus art work for sale on the walls!  This is the biggest Philz I've been to.  Every & their mom, including us, were looking for a quick breakfast place open in downtown San Mateo this past Labor Day.  Philz pretty much seemed to be the only place (and of course they're way better than Starbucks & Peet's).  

        We placed our drink order than the pay line is seperate per usual Philz standards and you can also order food here as well.  I like how they have the display by the front of the line rather than when you hit the register.  Also a little further down is their hot foods menu.  I had placed an order for a toasted croissant, a Philz bagel, and we also shared a large Iced Mint Mojito.  After a couple minutes the girl who rung me up called me and told me that the only plain bagel left looked kind of funny and she didn't want to serve it to me.  We totally appreciated her honesty, as perhaps some other establishments would have just served it.  So we went with the asiago bagel.  After about 5-7 minutes the drink was ready, and our food was ready in about 7-10.  But it was an extremely busy morning.  The Philz bagel is AMAZING!  It's cream cheese, cucumber, and tomato, and seasoned with olive oil and salt and pepper.  Simple yet delicious, and even better with the asiago bagel.

        Philz has been consistent with their drink taste and quality at all of the locations I've been to.  Staff members are friendly as well.  The large space, consistency and friendly cashier warning me about a weird looking bagel deserves a 5 for sure.

        11/8/2016

        I don't normally write reviews but with this location I had to.  My boyfriend and I each ordered mint mojitos.  As I was drinking, I would get small pieces of mint in my mouth.  I decided to open the lid to remove the mint since it kept bothering me....when I opened the cup, there was at least a handful of mint leaves in there!! Loll I don't mind the mint but holy crap, it was like a whole plant was shoved in my cup.  The Philz by SJSU only puts the two mint leafs on top of my drink so I was really surprised by the amount put in my large cup. Lol Anyway, I just wanted to share that. The drink came out good if u must know. Lol but next time I order a mint mojito at this location, I'll just ask for no mint leaves.

        8/6/2016
        • 3 check-ins

        We recently moved to San Mateo after having fallen in love with it. It's a story we like to tell people, it was raining and we ended up here at Philz.

        Except it's not true as I only just discovered. I somehow was able to check into the San Mateo location while in Redwood City, which lead to the honey and I believing that San Mateo was the place we wanted to live. It lead to us searching and finally finding a home in San Mateo. Which we love, so it all worked out.

        But apparently, we fell in love with Redwood City. And the Redwood City Philz was the Philz were visiting when we decided it would be an awesome area to live in. So after discovering this I switched over the review and am leaving a brand new (and correct) one for this location, which is amazing.

        We've been here numerous times and every time our service is steller. We've never had the polar bear issue at this location we had at Redwood City, and they've never mixed up our drink sizes. It's also awesome that this location is so close to Caltrain. Win!

        We adore this location and I was having the hardest time figuring out why it looked so different than the first time we were here! XD

        All in all, we'll keep coming back!

        8/7/2016
        • 1 check-in

        WOW, I swear this place is always busy!! The seats and tables are always crammed with people either working, doing homework, catching up with friends, or just playing games and lingering. This place has a very hip and casual vibe, it's a big establishment, and the set-up is pretty interesting.

        I ordered a black Jacobs coffee (size small), and almost forgot to pay for it! (Phew, that was a close one) You are supposed to order your drink at the front counter, and then take it to the cashier at a separate counter to pay for it.

        The Jacobs is a very good dark roast beverage. It's super bitter and gives you energy that'll last forever! I have yet to try the famous Mint Mojito.

        Bathrooms here are so clean! Parking is ample; you've got parking garages on both sides of the street and lots of street parking available to pick from.

        7/24/2016

        Really enjoyed our iced, sweet, mocha tesora and Philz everything bagel. Considering that the bagel came with cream cheese, tomato, and cucumber, it was a great deal. Also, the staff are super friendly. I didn't know the ordering system: you order your coffee from the first line then move to the second to pay and order food/pastries. (Yes, I realized after the steps are on the wall.)

        Came on a Sunday and this place is busy all day long! Luckily we snagged a table but be prepared to not find a seat. The good thing is parking is free on Sundays, but again, the later in the day it is, the harder it is to find.

        12/6/2015
        • 1 check-in

        Hard to say if I'll make it back to this Philz Coffee again so here - bam !!! 5 stars.

        Big coffee shop. Nice atmosphere, love the vibe, love the staff, iced mint mojito coffee and with plenty enough mint.

        Considering the fact that I'm used to finding the huge Siren logo, I didn't have a hard time finding this location and parking wasn't difficult as well. There is a garage to the back of the coffee shop - JUST BRING CHANGE.

        It wasn't difficult to order my java from this shop and unlike other non-(SBUX) shops, I didn't feel intimidated by this one. The barista was really friendly/accommodating !

        Most of all, the music that played was - of all tunes 90s music (Sublime, Nirvana, Gin Blossoms....) as if they knew I was coming that day. LOL ! Super cozy, very nice chill.

        Next time, San Mateo. Next time - it will be Philz, and it will be this shop !

        • My mint mojito coffee today ! Therapy drink
          My mint mojito coffee today ! Therapy drink

        • Follow James K.
        • Stop following James K.
        6/7/2016
        • 11 check-ins

        Coffee here is, as always, made only to order and with only the highest care and attention - much like any Philz. The friendly staff will gladly offer up suggestions if you feel like something different, and will happily customize if your drink isn't exactly how you wanted it to taste. Pro tip: Being able to order online (via OrderAhead) can save a lot of time if you already know what you want and just want to pop in to pick it up.

        The San Mateo branch is located in a gorgeous space with exposed brick all along one end, and two entrances, one for B street and one that leads out directly in the San Mateo downtown parking lot - convenient whether you've just parked or are just walking in. The unsurprising downside of the great location is that the space can become filled with people on laptops working away; there have been several times I've been by when there were just no empty seats available, so YMMV if you are planning to grab a seat or meet someone.

        Pros:
        Excellent coffee, expertly made
        Plenty of outlets for workers
        Good for working if you're not on a call

        Con:
        Plenty of workers for outlets
        Seating can fill up (see above)

        Was this review …?

        5/4/2016

        I have been to quite a few Philz and I have to admit, this is my favorite one. Its really deceiving from the outside but once you pass through those doors..the world seems to open up. Ok that was over dramatic but really it's so roomy inside!

        Its probably one of the larger Philz and I love the long bench in front of the barista where you can sit to wait for your perfectly brewed cup of joe. I'm not sure how they do it but its been perfect everytime I've been here. There are some locations that require multiple redo's but so far this one has been spot on.

        This Philz just seems easier to navigate especially if you are new to the way Philz operates. The smaller locations which are insanely packed adds to the newb confusion. Trust me, I have been there and didnt return for along time because of it. Here are my location preferences:

        San Mateo
        Sunnyvale
        Cupertino
        SF- Westborough
        SJ-Downtown
        and the palo alto locations are my least favorite of the bunch.

        Was this review …?
